Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat or Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in faded added white outline with faded added red centre; below, two white bands; exterior: at rim, band of diagonal strokes above dot and billet frieze; below, painted decoration consisting possibly of goat (rump and trace of possible tail remaining) to right; short vertical strokes as filling ornament; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Whilst goats are rarely depicted on vases in the Animal Chalice Style, interior decoration is virtually non-existent on vessels in the Wild Goat Style. This sherd may mark a transition between both styles. The number '51' is written in pencil on the sherd's interior surface.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pl. 21.1.12)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0404) (phase 2)
